intro: Anepsa, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in the evening. Its fruits are typically berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Anepsa is often found in rocky or arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
